Given the typical parameters used to run an experiment, return the path to the directory where data will be saved for this chip.

Given a folder path and range of experiments, get all of the unique .json file names that hold data in that directory.

Given a folder path and range of experiments, get all of the unique .json file names that hold data in that directory.

Given the typical parameters used to run an experiment, return the path to the directory where data will be saved for this device.

Given a folder path and range of experiments, get a list of the indices for the data in those experiments.

Given the typical parameters used to run an experiment, return the path to the directory where data will be saved for this wafer.

Increase experimentNumber in index.json by 1 and refresh the timestamp.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.incrementJSONIndex(directory)[source]¶

Increase index in index.json by 1 and refresh the timestamp.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadChipIndexes(directory)[source]¶

Given a chip’s folder path, load the index.json data for every device.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadJSON(directory, loadFileName)[source]¶

Load loadFileName.json as a dictionary.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadJSONIndex(directory)[source]¶

Load the first line of index.json in directory.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadJSON_fast(directory, loadFileName, minIndex=0, maxIndex=inf, minExperiment=0, maxExperiment=inf, minRelativeIndex=0, maxRelativeIndex=inf)[source]¶

Private method. Given filters of min/max index, experimentNumber, and relativeIndex this loads individual file lines much faster.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadJSON_slow(directory, loadFileName)[source]¶

Private method. This is the traditional way of parsing json data files, but it can be slow if you only need to see one line in a large file.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadJSONtoStringArray(directory, loadFileName)[source]¶
source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadMostRecentChipHistory(directory, fileName, numberOfRecentExperiments=1, specificDeviceList=None)[source]¶

Given a chip’s folder path and a data fileName, load the most recently saved jsonData for devices on that chip. The default loads all devices on the chip but specific devices can also be specified.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadMostRecentDeviceHistory(directory, fileName, numberOfRecentExperiments=1)[source]¶

Given a folder path and fileName, load most recent data for a device. Can specify the number of recent experiments to include.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadOldestChipHistory(directory, fileName, numberOfOldestExperiments=1, specificDeviceList=None)[source]¶

Given a chip’s folder path and a data fileName, load the oldest saved jsonData for devices on that chip. The default loads all devices on the chip but specific devices can also be specified.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadOldestDeviceHistory(directory, fileName, numberOfOldestExperiments=1)[source]¶

Given a folder path and fileName, load oldest data for a device. Can specify the number of oldest experiments to include.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadSpecificChipHistory(directory, fileName, specificDeviceList=None, minIndex=0, maxIndex=inf, minExperiment=0, maxExperiment=inf, minRelativeIndex=0, maxRelativeIndex=inf)[source]¶

Given a chip’s folder path and a data fileName, load data over a range of indices or experiments for devices on that chip. The default loads all devices on the chip but specific devices can also be specified.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.loadSpecificDeviceHistory(directory, fileName, minIndex=0, maxIndex=inf, minExperiment=0, maxExperiment=inf, minRelativeIndex=0, maxRelativeIndex=inf)[source]¶

Given a folder path and fileName, load data for a device over a range of indices or experiments. If minIndex/maxIndex or minExperiment/maxExperiment are negative, then index backwards (-1 == the most recent index/experiment)

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.makeFolder(folderPath)[source]¶

Create all of the folders in folderPath if they do not already exist.

source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.parseJSON(fileLines)[source]¶
source.utilities.DataLoggerUtility.saveJSON(directory, saveFileName, jsonData, subDirectory=None, incrementIndex=True)[source]¶

Save the jsonData dictionary to as saveFileName.json in directory. If incrementIndex is True, also create an index.json file that tracks the index and experimentNumber of this jsonData. If subDirectory is not None, put saveFileName.json in a folder specified by directory + subDirectory. index.json is still put in directory.

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility module¶

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility.default_mode_parameters = {'colorsOverride': [], 'default_png_dpi': 300, 'enableColorBar': True, 'enableErrorBars': True, 'enableGradient': False, 'figureSizeOverride': None, 'generalInfo': None, 'includeDualAxis': True, 'includeGateCurrent': False, 'includeOffCurrent': True, 'legendLabels': [], 'legendLoc': 'best', 'legendTitleSuffix': '', 'plotInRealTime': True, 'plotSaveExtension': '.png', 'plotSaveFolder': '../../AutexysPlots/', 'plotSaveName': '', 'publication_mode': False, 'saveFigures': True, 'showFigures': True, 'staticBiasChangeDividers': True, 'staticBiasSegmentDividers': False, 'sweepDirection': 'both', 'timescale': ''}¶

IMPORTANT: while these methods are helpful, they have also been completely wrapped by Device_History and Chip_History, and so these versions are intended to be private.

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility.getDataFileDependencies(plotType)[source]¶

Returns a list of data files needed to make the given plotType.

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility.getPlotTypesFromDependencies(availableDataFiles, plotCategory='device')[source]¶

Returns a list of plotTypes that can be made from the given data files. plotCategory can choose between device or chip plots.

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility.makeChipPlot(plotType, identifiers, chipIndexes=None, firstRunChipHistory=None, recentRunChipHistory=None, specificRunChipHistory=None, mode_parameters=None)[source]¶

Given a plotType that matches one of the plotDefinitions in the plotDefinitions folder, as well as a variety of chip data, and a dictionary containing the user/project/wafer/chip identifiers for this data, generate the requested plot. The plot can be shown by a later call to show(). Given the complexity of different requirements for different plots, it is highly recommended that Chip_History.makePlot() is used instead.

mode_parameters is an optional dictionary of plotting parameters that affect the style of many of the plots. mode_parameters should be a dictionary that includes some of the keys shown above in default_mode_parameters, and the union of these two dictionaries will be passed to the plots.

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility.makeDevicePlot(plotType, deviceHistory, identifiers, mode_parameters=None)[source]¶

Given a plotType that matches one of the plotDefinitions in the plotDefinitions folder, as well as an array of data for a device, and a dictionary containing the user/project/wafer/chip/device identifiers for this data, generate the requested plot. The plot can be shown by a later call to show().

mode_parameters is an optional dictionary of plotting parameters that affect the style of many of the plots. mode_parameters should be a dictionary that includes some of the keys shown above in default_mode_parameters, and the union of these two dictionaries will be passed to the plots.

source.utilities.DataPlotterUtility.show()[source]¶

Shows all plots that have been previously generated by makeDevicePlot() or makeChipPlot()

source.utilities.MatplotlibUtility module¶

A utility designed to help with the creation a plots with matplotlib that all use a consistent style.
